content.description: Start on the on some thin crimps and balance your way onto the wall.  Move directly up and top out.
content.location: This problem is on the north face of the Looney Bin.  This is the face you pass as you walk the trail past the mailbox up onto the hill.  The problem is on the right of the slab.

content.description: This has a spread out sit start, keep your feet off the flakey rock underneath. All holds are clearly marked, and there are plenty of other holds to use if you have trouble, but it is an easy climb.
content.protection: A pad and a weed wacker.
content.location: It's the first boulder on the right by the start of the trailhead. Disturbia is on the left of the East-facing wall.

content.description:
This problem is an eliminate problem as the arete is off.  Stand start on the only obvious crimp on the low part of the wall.  Move up through sparse thin crimps and feet.  Just as you are getting high, latch on to the glory hold ledge at the top.  Find some good feet for the topout as you will be about 12 feet up at this point.

The rock is mossy, so the good holds are hidden.  It's fun picking them out and feeling around.
content.location: This problem is on the north face of the Looney Bin.  This is the face the trail passes.  This problem scales the left side of the face just to the left of the arete.
